desc:
A memorandum dated February 9, 1967 proposed changes to the 1967/68 construction estimate for Fort Franklin Hostel. Three 12-bed hostels were scheduled to be constructed in 1967/68 and had now been changed to one 12-bed hostel.
A memorandum dated June 13, 1967 stated that an 8-bed pupil residence at Fort Franklin had been completed as of March 31, 1967. It also revealed that the 12- bed pupil residence scheduled for 1968/69 could be deferred due to the availability of foster home care in Fort Franklin.
The Fort Franklin Hostel opened September 1967.
Attendance records pertaining to the start of the 1969 school year showed zero students in residence at the Fort Franklin Hostel, indicating that the hostel did not operate that year.
The Fort Franklin Hostel had been open for only a few days in 1971.
A letter dated March 22, 1973 stated that the hostel had not been open during the past year and had been open for only a few days as a hostel in the previous year.

ref: Eskimo Point Repulse Bay Whale Cove Sandy Point Rankin Inlet Padlei

additionalInformation.notes: A letter dated February 16, 1968 from the Principal of Fort Franklin School stated that since hostel children have no pocket money, they have free admission to movies shown at the Community Hall by the Fort Franklin Community Club. The admission fees would be considered as part of the running expense of the Hostel.
